required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Management of Major Bleeding Events in Atrial Fibrillation Patients Using Pradaxa
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Cohort Study With Chart Review to Assess the Management of Major Bleeding Events in NVAF Patients Treated With Dabigatran Etexilate

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being conducted to collect data on the management of major bleeding events occurring in patients with atrial fibrillation taking dabigatran etexilate.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects With Index Event Safety Outcomes (Resolved / Recovery Ongoing / Deceased) at the Time of Their Hospital Discharge / Release.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of presentation / admission to an ED / ER or hospitalization through all in-hospital referrals until discharge (between 20 August 2014 (the date of the first data entry) and 4 March 2015 (the date of data entry closure)); Up to 196 days
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects with index event safety outcomes (resolved / recovery ongoing / deceased) at the time of their hospital discharge / release.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects Receiving Different Types of Interventions (i.e., Medication / Procedure and Surgery) to Manage the Index Events Until Their Hospital Discharge / Release
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of presentation / admission to an ED / ER or hospitalization through all in-hospital referrals until discharge (between 20 August 2014 (the date of the first data entry) and 4 March 2015 (the date of data entry closure)); Up to 196 days
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects receiving different types of interventions (i.e., medication / procedure and surgery) to manage the index events until their hospital discharge / release.

primary_outcome.measure: Index Event Characteristics (i.e. Type of Bleeding and Anatomic Locations of the Index Event) at the Time of the ED / ER Presentation or Hospitalization
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of presentation / admission to an ED / ER or hospitalization through all in-hospital referrals until discharge (between 20 August 2014 (the date of the first data entry) and 4 March 2015 (the date of data entry closure)); Up to 196 days
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of Index events by anatomic location and type are presented. The categories of Unknown and Other presented below correspond to, Unknown: Unknown location of bleeding met the criteria for major bleeding as defined by the International Society on Thrombosis and Haemostasis (ISTH). Other: Other types of bleeding represent a combined category of all other locations of bleeding whose incidence was <1.7%.

study_pop.textblock: AF patients with bleeding event using Dabigatran etexilate

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This is a retrospective observational study. 284 subjects were captured in the initial screening. 93 subjects were found not to meet the eligibility criteria and were excluded from the study, leaving 191 subjects eligible for study entry who were enrolled and included in the final study.

group.title: Dabigatran Etexilate (Pradaxa®)
group.description: Patients with Non-Valvular Atrial Fibrillation (NVAF) at five U.S. sites who received dabigatran (at the 75 mg and 150 mg dosages, orally twice daily), who had an acute bleeding event (index event), and either presented to an Emergency Department/ Emergency Room (ED / ER) or were hospitalized primarily for management of a major bleeding event.

baseline.population: Patients who received treatment at the five study sites.

outcome.description: Proportion of subjects with index event safety outcomes (resolved / recovery ongoing / deceased) at the time of their hospital discharge / release.
outcome.time_frame: From the time of presentation / admission to an ED / ER or hospitalization through all in-hospital referrals until discharge (between 20 August 2014 (the date of the first data entry) and 4 March 2015 (the date of data entry closure)); Up to 196 days
outcome.population: Patients who received treatment at the five study sites

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) acknowledges that investigators have the right to publish the study results. Investigators shall provide BI with a copy of any publication or presentation for review prior to any submission. Such review will be done with regard to proprietary information, information related to patentable inventions, medical, scientific, and statistical accuracy within 60 days. BI may request a delay of the publication in order to protect BI’s intellectual property rights
